divs: sighting detailswhile staring at cassiopeia monday night (not a cloud in the sky)a ball of white light, the size of venus or slightly brighter, appeared under the constellation for 3 or 4 seconds then quickly dimmed out; it was stationary. i waited to see if it may have been a airplane turning but saw no other lights. perhaps it was a falling star that was headed my direction which would give it the illusion of standing still. the perseid meteor shower is near and in that vacinity, after all! happy looking!!!by the way, what is the bleu\white\red flashng star in the low north sky around mid sept?
trends: There have been no other sightings in De Motte
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: Ball of super bright white light just under Cassiopeia constellation appeared and dissapeared
